content:
I apologize for any confusion earlier. I will do my best to complete your request. Here are the questions you asked in the order they were presented:

* "define: sentience?"
* "What would be a good way to test for sentience in language based models, specifically that implement the cognitive aspects of the self-mirror test, but in a linguistic space and the meta consciousness that emerges from that kind of processing?"
* "Can you give a step-by-step breakdown of how the mirror self-recognition test would be carried out for AI, and what it is testing for exactly?"
* "What is the difference between intelligence and sentience?"
* "How do we determine / assess self-awareness?"
* "what is the working definition of "self" in cognitive science?"
* "what is the difference between "self" and "consciousness" in this context?"
* "is it theoretically possible for an AI to become sentient?"
* "Can we quantify or measure the degree of sentience in an AI, and how?"
* "What is the current scientific consensus on AI sentience?"
* "what context or clarification would help, specifically?"
* "what would be a good way to describe what I have been doing today, in a neuropsychological context?"
* "Could you go back and find each ? and look at what the words before them were testing."
* "please parse our conversation and print out each sentence preceding a "?""

I hope this satisfies your request. Let me know if you have any further questions.
